value: Statue of Daugai at the entrance to the town

. It lies on the bank of the lake of Daugai, thus becoming a holiday resort, and has approximately 1,450 inhabitants.

Due to the fact that Daugai is small city, there is no public transport in the town. You can actually reach every place of the town on foot or by bicycle (unfortunately, you should have your own one since there is no bike-renting point).
Since Daugai is holiday resort, there isn't much to see, because the majority of tourist come there because of the lake. Although there are few interesting places to go to:

value: content=It is a romantic church with
elements, built in 1862, architect – Tomas Tišeckis. One of the most important churches of the Daugai parish.
content=This mysterious place is in the grove nearby the plage with the same name (alternatively

). Daugai used to be a Jewish city, but in the World War II Nazis killed almost all Jewish inhabitants and they were buried on this cemetery. There are stones with names and strange paths. It stretches over the whole peninsula in the lake of Daugai. It's not fenced, so you can visit cemetery any time you want. If you like extreme, visit it at night.
name=Plages of the lake of Daugai
content=Plages were reconstructed in 2012, they are wide and modern now. The waterside is save sand-based.
content=Fish of the lake of Daugai is very delicious. You can't buy it in food shops, but if you find local fisherman, you will taste one of the best fish in

There is no restaurants or cafés in Daugai, but there are few markets. The biggest is „Maxima“. It's the largest Lithuanian supermarket chain. Althoug there is only one Maxima shop in Daugai, it's enough for everyday life and you can get there a range of different products. Besides there are 4 smaller food shops.
Daugai has no bars or nightclubs.
